headline: Both are exceptional; timing determines the better choice
summary: The Serengeti and Masai Mara are part of the same ecosystem separated by a border. The migration moves between them seasonally. The Serengeti offers greater scale and variety across regions. The Mara offers compact, concentrated wildlife with off-road driving permitted. For migration, timing determines which side is better; for general safari, both deliver exceptionally.

assumptions.text: Serengeti and Mara are the same ecosystem; the migration moves between them.
The Serengeti is much larger with more variety across regions.
The Masai Mara allows off-road driving; Tanzania national parks do not.

gains: Serengeti: Greater scale and regional variety
Serengeti: Combined with Ngorongoro for diversity
Mara: Compact area with high wildlife density
Mara: Off-road driving for better positioning
losses: Serengeti: On-road only in national park
Serengeti: More transit time between regions

change_conditions: If visiting July-October, the Mara has the migration and river crossings.
If visiting November-June, the Serengeti has the migration.
If off-road driving matters for photography, the Mara has the advantage.
If combining with other Tanzania experiences, the Serengeti fits better.
